subSections.title: References
subSections.text:
{{Han ref|kx=0824.010|dkj=23935|dj=1235.270|hdz=42581.020|uh=77E5}}

[[Category:Han characters from which hiragana were derived|ち]]

subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etym}}
{{Han compound|矢|口|t1=arrow|t2=mouth|c1=p|c2=s|ls=psc}}. This may also be an {{liushu|i|nocap=y}} – words coming out of people who know are like arrows being fired.

subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text: The two pronunciations are cognate. The word is possibly of Sino-Tibetan origin, compare {{cog|lus|hria}}, {{m|lus|hriat||to know}}, {{cog|kac|chye||to know}}, {{cog|bo|རིག||to know}} ({{zh-ref|Schuessler, 2007}}).
